snippet: In a little over a decade, Jennifer Sultan, 38, went from seeming Internet riches to bankruptcy and an arrest on drug and gun charges.
abstract: Jennifer Sultan of Manhattan, who rode the late 1990s technology stock boom to become a dot-com millionaire at age 25 less than a decade ago, is now 38, bankrupt and facing 15 years to life in prison on charges of selling prescription drugs to a New York City undercover police officer after posting the narcotics for sale on Craigslist.

byline.contributor: Colin Moynihan and Nate Schweber contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: In a little over a decade, Jennifer Sultan, 38, went from seeming Internet riches to bankruptcy and an arrest on drug and gun charges.

headline.seo: For Jennifer Sultan, a Dot-Com Bust
headline.main: For Jennifer Sultan, a Dot-Com Bust
